div.div: Ἰθάκη : Ithaca.—(1) the native island of Odysseus, with Mts. Neritus, Neius, and Corax, and the harbor Reithrum. Epithets, ἀμφίαλος, εὐδείελος, ἐυκτιμένη, κραναή, παιπαλόεσσα, τρηχεῖα.—(2) the city, at the foot of Mt. Neius, Od. 3.81, cf. Od. 16.322 .—Ἰθάκηνδε, to Ithaca.—Ἰθακήσιος: inhabitant of Ithaca, Ithacan.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
